curated_text: Symbol: V. Year: 2023. Period: Q2. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: Visa, Division, Contents VISA INC, CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (UNAUDITED)—(Continued) Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Litigation, European Commission Client Incentive Agreements Investigation, EC, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Visa Inc., the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act, COVID-19, SEC, Contents Overview Visa, VisaNet, Diluted, European Union, Europe Retrospective Responsibility, Legal Matters, Interlink, U.S. International Visa Inc., International Visa Inc., NM - Not, TM, • Interest, Capital Resources Cash Flow Data, The Financial Accounting Standards Board, Company, Issuer Purchases, Shares Purchased, Mine Safety Disclosures, Equity Incentive Compensation Plan Stock Option Award Agreement, Equity Incentive Compensation Plan Performance Share Award Agreement, Alternate Visa Inc., Financial, the Interactive Data File, the Securities Exchange Act, VISA INC. Context excerpt: competition with other payment methods and networks. Visa is cooperating with the Division in connection with the investigation. 26 Table of Contents VISA INC. NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (UNAUDITED)—(Continued) Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Litigation On December 21, 2022, plaintiffs filed a third amended complaint asserting the same claims as asserted in the prior complaints. On February 3, 2023, Visa filed a motion to dismiss the third amended complaint. European Commission Client Incentive Agreements Investigation On December 2, 2022, the EC informed Visa that it had opened a preliminary investigation into Visa’s incentive agreements with clients. Visa is cooperating with the EC in connection with the investigation. 27 Table of Contents ITEM 2.
